intro: Picris persica, commonly known as Persian sowthistle, is an annual herb native to temperate regions of Asia and Europe. It features a smooth, upright stem that can grow up to 60 cm in height, often branching towards the upper part. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly rough texture. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster, typically blooming from late spring to early summer. The plant is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils, making it a common weed in agricultural fields.
